location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letters No. 107-108 to Rawson Hart Boddam, President and Governor for the Public Department, Council at Bombay, from Edward Galley at Bushire

mods.abstract: The letter acknowledges commands received from the Morning Starincluding publications regarding the company's debt. Several financial and administrative matters are discussed including Galley's concern that the extraordinary expenses submitted by him to the council (detailed in item IOR/R/15/1/3, p 131 1) have been questioned. The letter states that montly accounts for February and March are enclosed (they are not contained in the file) and records the outstanding debt owed to the Resident by the company.A list with details of the different kinds of Bengal goods bought and sold annually in Bushire is contained below the letter.The letter is numbered No. 107. The list of Bengal goods is numbered No. 108.
